text: Milene Domingues Aganzo (born 18 June 1979) is a Brazilian former footballer who played as a midfielder. ==Career== Born in São Paulo, Domingues was first signed by SC Corinthians and finished her playing career with CF Pozuelo de Alarcón. The ex-model holds the women's record for ball juggling, keeping a football off the ground with 55,198 touches.Brazilian magazine Corpo A Corpo article about Milene Domingues She was the most expensive female football player in Spain, costing over £200,000.Mrs Ronaldo in record transfer BBC Sports 12 September 2002. Retrieved 18 February 2007. At international level she represented the Brazil women's national football team at the 2003 Women's World Cup. ==Personal life== She was married to football star Ronaldo from April 1999 to September 2003.El equipo de «Ronaldinha»» Together they have one son, Ronnie, who was born in Milan, on 6 April 2000. Later, Domingues married Spanish footballer David Aganzo. She is a Buddhist. ==References== ==External links== * Official site Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:Brazilian Buddhists Category:Sportspeople from São Paulo Category:Brazilian women's footballers Category:Women's association football midfielders Category:Brazilian expatriate women's footballers Category:Brazilian expatriate sportspeople in Spain Category:Footballers' wives and girlfriends Category:Expatriate women's footballers in Italy Category:Expatriate women's footballers in Spain Category:Primera División (women) players Category:Rayo Vallecano Femenino players Category:Serie A (women's football) players Category:Brazil women's international footballers Category:Freestyle footballers Category:Brazilian expatriate sportspeople in Italy Category:ASD Fiammamonza 1970 players Category:2003 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:Sport Club Corinthians Paulista (women) players
title: Milene Domingues
